intro: Buphthalmum durum, commonly known as the woolly oxeye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with a prominent central disk, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Buphthalmum durum is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens.
